Body: The android ICS or later version(JB) use /data/media directory for internal SD card, and use fuse for mounting the emulator internal sd card device (/dev/fuse).As we know if we use fuse, the files access have to communicate with userspace with low effect, why android do not use a stackable passthru filesystem such as wrapfs(wrapfs.filesystems.org) to mount the /data/media direct to internal sd card path(/storage/scard0)?Especially, we have the MTP option access internal sdcard and external sdcard for PC(windows)
Title: Why does Android use fuse for internal SD card mount?

history.Text: The android 4.0 or later version use /data/media directory for internal SD card, and use fuse for mounting the emulater internal sd card device (/dev/fuse). As we know if we use fuse, the files access have to communicate with userspace with low effect, why android do not use a stackable passthru filesystem such as wrapfs(wrapfs.filesystems.org) to mount the /data/media direct to internal sd card path(/storage/scard0). Especially, the Mass Storage option for PC is gone and use MTP instead for internal sdcard access(emulate the FAT32 with fuse seem unneccessary).
Why android use fuse for internal SD card mount?
